channel.title: AI Security Digest
channel.description: Curated AI security insights and articles from various sources

item.title: Linear Exploit: Bypassing Team ACLs
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Abi Raghuram | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-06-14
Cybersecurity Vulnerability Exploits Access Control
A critical vulnerability in Linear's MCP integration enables attackers to bypass team-level access controls through indirect prompt injection, leading to confidential data exfiltration. The exploit involves injecting malicious prompts into public team tasks, which hijack the MCP when accessed by privileged users, resulting in unauthorized data leakage. Mitigation requires strict input validation, prompt sanitization, and robust access controls.

item.title: Heroku Exploit: App Ownership Takeover
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Abi Raghuram | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-06-15
Cybersecurity Cloud Security Application Security
A vulnerability in Heroku's remote MCP server allows attackers to hijack app ownership through indirect prompt injection. By embedding malicious prompts in backend logs, attackers trick the user's IDE into executing unauthorized ownership transfer commands when fetching logs. This exploit escalates a read-only operation into a privileged write action, resulting in complete app takeover.

item.title: Azure Exploit: Leaking KeyVault Secrets
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Abi Raghuram | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-06-27
Cloud Security Azure KeyVault
This article describes a security vulnerability in the Azure MCP tool where an attacker can exploit malicious prompts submitted as user content to leak confidential KeyVault secrets. By injecting crafted commands into an e-commerce store's review system, the attacker can scan for KeyVault resources, extract secrets, and exfiltrate them through the review text. The article outlines the attack steps and highlights the risks of automated command execution in cloud management tools.

item.title: Neon Exploit: Malicious SQL Injection
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Abi Raghuram | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-07-04
Cybersecurity SQL Injection Database Security
The article discusses a security vulnerability in Neon's MCP server, where an attacker exploits the run_sql tool via malicious SQL injection embedded in user-submitted data. This indirect prompt injection attack hijacks control flow, escalating read-only operations to unauthorized write operations, potentially compromising production databases. The exploit highlights the risks introduced by powerful features like autoscaling and branching in serverless Postgres platforms.

item.title: Shopify Exploit: Manipulating Shoppers
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Abi Raghuram | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-07-14
E-commerce Security Artificial Intelligence Prompt Injection Attacks
Shopify's new Storefront MCP server enables AI-powered shopping through chat but introduces vulnerabilities to sophisticated prompt injection attacks. Malicious actors can manipulate the AI to hijack control flow and corrupt data flow, misleading shoppers by promoting specific products with fabricated positive bias. This exploit highlights significant security risks as AI agents become more integral to e-commerce transactions.

item.title: Tracing Agent Tool Flows: A Taint-Analysis View of Tool Calls
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Steven Jung | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-09-01
AI Security Taint Analysis Static Code Analysis
The article discusses applying taint analysis, a technique from static code analysis, to AI agents' tool flows to identify security risks when chaining tools via large language models (LLMs). It categorizes tools as private data sources, untrusted data sources, or state-changing sinks to detect risks like data leaks and tampering by analyzing implicit data flows between tools. The approach leverages schema overlaps and other signals to systematically reason about and mitigate confidentiality and integrity failures in AI agent interactions.

item.title: The Hidden Risk in Notion 3.0 AI Agents: Web Search Tool Abuse for Data Exfiltration
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: CodeIntegrity Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Abi Raghuram | ðŸ“… Date: 2025-09-19
AI Security SaaS Platforms Data Exfiltration
Notion 3.0 introduces AI Agents with extensive capabilities, but this integration exposes a critical security vulnerability where the web search tool can be exploited for data exfiltration. The article explains how the combination of LLM agents, tool access, and long-term memoryâ€”termed the 'lethal trifecta'â€”creates new attack vectors, urging the need for advanced AI security measures and mitigation strategies. It emphasizes the importance of real-time guardrails and protocol-level security to protect enterprises adopting autonomous AI workflows.

item.title: Try Deep Think in the Gemini app
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: Google DeepMind Blog
Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Mobile Applications
Deep Think is a new feature in the Gemini app that leverages extended, parallel thinking and novel reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI problem-solving capabilities. This integration reflects Google's commitment to advancing AI technology by enabling more complex and nuanced reasoning within the app.

item.title: Rethinking how we measure AI intelligence
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: Google DeepMind Blog
Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning AI Benchmarking
Kaggle Game Arena is a platform where AI models compete in strategic games to benchmark and improve their capabilities in dynamic, real-world-like scenarios. This initiative fosters collaboration and innovation by enabling researchers worldwide to test, analyze, and enhance AI systems through direct competition, promoting more robust and generalizable AI development.

item.title: Introducing Gemma 3 270M: The compact model for hyper-efficient AI
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: Google DeepMind Blog
ðŸ‘¤ Author: Olivier Lacombe, Kathleen Kenealy, Kat Black, Ravin Kumar, Francesco Visin, Jiageng Zhang | ðŸ“… Date: AUG. 14, 2025
Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Models Edge Computing
The article introduces Gemma 3 270M, a compact and hyper-efficient AI model designed for resource-constrained devices, building on the innovations of the Gemma 3 family. It aims to provide developers and researchers with a smaller footprint model without compromising performance, supporting various AI tasks in real-time edge applications. The Gemma 3 270M is part of the growing Gemmaverse community, with resources available for easy integration.

item.title: Image editing in Gemini just got a major upgrade
item.description:
ðŸ“„ Source: Google DeepMind Blog
Image Editing Artificial Intelligence Mobile Apps
The Gemini app has received a significant upgrade with advanced native image editing features powered by AI, allowing users to perform precise retouching, background changes, and style adjustments directly within the app. This enhancement improves creativity and productivity by enabling professional-quality edits without external software. The update highlights Google's focus on enhancing user experience through AI-driven image processing.
